definition: Zhang Xueliang (1901-2001) son of Fengtian clique warlord, then senior general for the Nationalists and subsequently for the People's Liberation Army
surname Zhang
to open up/to spread/sheet of paper/classifier for flat objects, sheet/classifier for votes
to learn/to study/to imitate/science/-ology
good/very/very much

sentences.english: General Zhang Xueliang is a typical representative of patriotism in modern Chinese history.
sentences.chinese: 张学良将军是中国近现代史上爱国主义的典型代表。

sentences.english: But since then, Zhang never came to Lushan Mountain any more.
sentences.chinese: 但从那以后，张学良再也没上过庐山。

sentences.english: Peter H. L. Chang's viewpoint of national unity is an important part of his patriotism.
sentences.chinese: 张学良的国家统一思想是其爱国主义的重要组成部分。

sentences.english: There have been many years since Song Ziwen and Zhang Xueliang made friends.
sentences.chinese: 宋子文与张学良相交多年，两人以兄弟相称。

sentences.english: Zhang Xueliang was to a large extent independent of the National Government.
sentences.chinese: 张学良对中央政府具有相当大的独立性。

sentences.english: Peter H. L. Chang is a great patriot and national hero.
sentences.chinese: 张学良是伟大的爱国者和民族英雄。

sentences.english: After returning to Nanjing, Chiang Kai-shek immediately imprisoned Zhang Xueliang.
sentences.chinese: 蒋介石飞回南京后，立即把张学良拘禁起来。

definition: Chiang Kai-shek (1887-1975), military leader, head of the Nationalist government in China 1928-1949 and the government in exile on Taiwan 1950-1975
Yang Hucheng (1893-1949), Chinese warlord and Nationalist general
Zhang Zuolin (c. 1873-1928), warlord of Manchuria 1916-1928
Feng Yuxiang (1882-1948), warlord during Republic of China, strongly critical of Chiang Kai-shek
Soong Mei-ling (1898-2003), Chiang Kai-shek's second wife
Li Zongren (1891-1969), a leader of Guangxi warlord faction
He Yingqin (1890-1987), senior Guomindang general
Wang Ching-wei (1883-1944), left-wing Guomingdang politician, subsequently Japanese collaborator
Yan Xishan (1883-1960), warlord in Shanxi
Xi'an Incident of 12th December 1936 (kidnap of Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石[Jiang3 Jie4 shi2])
Zhang Zhizhong (1890-1969), National Revolutionary Army general
Bai Chongxi (1893-1966), a leader of Guangxi warlord faction, top Nationalist general, played important role in Chiang Kaishek's campaigns 1926-1949
Chiang Ching-kuo (1910-1988), son of Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石, Guomindang politician, president of ROC 1978-1988
Fu Zuoyi (1895-1974), Guomindang general, subsequently PRC top general and politician
Zhou Enlai (1898-1976), Chinese communist leader, prime minister 1949-1976
Duan Qirui (1864-1936), commander of Beiyang Army under Yuan Shikai, then politician and powerful warlord
